text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I want to share with

you a really easy, simple, fast dessert recipe,
dessert idea that you can do last minute if

you've got you know, friends coming over mid-week
or if you just don't want to spend a lot of

time in the kitchen on the weekends but you
want to serve something sweet at the end of

your dinner get together or what not, I think
these are great, I call these my pineapple

upside down sundaes, so it basically tastes
like a pineapple upside down cake, but in

sort of like a sundae version, it's easy,
it's delicious, going to use just a little

bit of help from the store to kinda keep things
moving a little bit faster, and I find that

that's what I'm really focusing a lot more
on recently because we spend so much time

outside in the Spring and Summer, we've got
people over every weekend and during the week

as well, I don't want to spend a lot of time
inside making something elaborate, so I've

been turning to really easy, quick ideas that
we just love or things that can be assembled

and popped into the fridge way in advance
so that it doesn't take any attention from
me at that moment because I want to be outside!

Okay, let me run you through the list of ingredients,
not very big but it's all the right ones.

I'm using fresh pineapple that I have just
chopped into bite size pieces, make sure you

core it but most grocery stores will sell
diced pineapple already so keep an eye out
for that.

Brown sugar, salted macadamia nuts, you need
some pound cake, you can have a store-bought

like I did, my grocery store has a bakery
and they make pretty good pound cake so I

went ahead and purchased that, you need a
little bit of vanilla, some heavy cream, and
you'll need some butter.
You also need ice cream, obviously.

But this is so easy you are going to absolutely
adore it.

So, we've got two pans going, I'm just going
to turn both of them on.
The back one's going to be on really low.

To the back one, I'm going to add the butter,
and the brown sugar, and I'm going to let

that melt, once that melts, and comes to a
bubble, I'm going to go ahead and add in my

pineapple, to my skillet over here, what I'm
going to do is I'm going to melt the butter

and then I'm going to toast my pound cake,
it's almost like the way you would make a

grilled cheese, obviously there's no cheese
here, but I wanted to toast it in some butter

and really develop a beautiful golden brown
crust that's going to add a little something

extra to your ice cream sundae, but if you
don't want to go through this step, then don't

but I do think that if you're going to use
a little bit of help from the store by buying

pound cake, jujj it up, make it a little bit
special, toast it up it gives you a really

lovely nutty crust that I think just makes
things a little more special, you know?

So I'm going to go ahead and keep an eye out
on my pound cake, going to flip it halfway

through, gotta keep an eye out for that, and
wait for that to come to a bubble and then
I'll show you the next step.

That's perfect, I'm going to go ahead and
add the pineapple, and now you're just going

to cook this just on low for maybe 5 to 6
minutes, you want the pineapple to cook down

a bit, soften a bit, it's going to be so fantastic,
just you wait.
My pound cake looks amazing.

If the sides crumble a little bit, it's perfectly
fine just adds to the rustic beautiful look

of it and just wait until you see it plated,
it's going to be a thing of absolute beauty.

And I can't wait to share it with you once
we're done, but I'm just going to keep and

eye out on the pineapple and when it's where
I want it then I will share that with you
when it gets there.

That looks perfect, going to add in the macadamia
nuts.
Let those get nice and toasty.
Along with a small splash of good vanilla.

Gotta be good quality vanilla extract, I have
to make a new batch, I haven't made it in
a while, because I've had so much.

And I'm just going to add a very small splash
of heavy cream and I'm just going to let this

cook for about one more minute and then I'm
going to let this cool quite a bit before

we go ahead and assemble our sundaes because
this is so boiling hot it's technically melted

sugar and it would scorch your mouth and would
also melt everything too fast so it's important

that you let it cool for a bit and then we
build a sundae.

My pineapple sauce is ready, it's still quite
hot but you know what I can't hold off anymore.

I've got my perfectly toasted piece of pound
cake, a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream, and

then you just take this pineapple with the
pecans and as it cools it will thicken into

absolute perfection but you know we can't
all be perfect at everything.

I just can't wait any longer, and then you
stick that with the maraschino cherry.

Make sure it has a stem because it really
